snippet: SCA Promotions, which paid Lance Armstrong millions of dollars in bonuses for winning the Tour de France, is seeking its money back because Armstrong was stripped of his titles.
abstract: SCA Promotions, insurance company that paid Lance Armstrong millions of dollars in bonuses for winning the Tour de France, files lawsuit against Armstrong, claiming that Armstrong, his agent Bill Stapleton and Tailwind Sports, Armstrong’s former management company, must repay at least $12 million because Armstrong is no longer official Tour winner; lawsuit also asserts that Armstrong had committed fraud against SCA when he said under oath that he had never used performance-enhancing drugs.
lead_paragraph: SCA Promotions, which paid Lance Armstrong millions of dollars in bonuses for winning the Tour de France, is seeking its money back because Armstrong was stripped of his titles.

headline.seo: SCA Promotions Sues Lance Armstrong, Seeking Repayment
headline.main: Company Sues to Recoup Money From Armstrong
headline.print_headline: Company Sues to Recoup Money From Armstrong
